intro: Silene bella, commonly known as the beautiful catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Silene bella has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
